subject: Leadership
title: Clarity Over Cleverness
description: Learn Clarity Over Cleverness in one minute.

hook.text: A leader sends a memo packed with jargon. Half the team reads it differently. Confusion spreads. Deadlines slip.

buildup.text: Clarity is the foundation of effective leadership communication. If people must decode your message, you've failed.

discovery.text: The curse of knowledge: experts forget what it's like not to know. They speak in code only insiders can follow.

twist.text: Simple language isn't dumbing down. It's leveling up. Einstein: 'If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand.'

climax.text: Test clarity by explaining your idea to someone outside your field. If they get it in 30 seconds, you're ready.

punchline.text: Don't impress people with your words. Move them with your clarity.

quiz.question: What is the 'curse of knowledge'?
options: Forgetting what it's like not to know something
